member.name: Amy Zhang
member.bio: Amy X. Zhang is an assistant professor at University of Washington's Allen School of Computer Science and Engineering, where she directs the Social Futures Lab. Her research interests are in social computing and HCI.

member.name: Shagun Jhaver
member.bio: Shagun Jhaver is a postdoctoral researcher in the Social Futures Lab. His research focuses on online harassment and content moderation on social media websites like Facebook, Twitter and Reddit.

member.name: Quan Ze (Jim) Chen
member.bio: I'm a current PhD student. My primary research interests are in crowdsourcing, AI and human computer interaction. Also feel free to check out my other projects on GitHub :)

member.name: Ruotong Wang
member.bio: Ruotong Wang is a first year Ph.D. student at University of Washington's Allen School of Computer Science and Engineering.

member.name: Ge Zhang
member.bio: Ge Zhang is a senior undergraduate student at Peking University. Her research interests are in data mining and human-computer interaction, with a focus on scientific reproducibility and data science collaboration.

member.name: Wenjia Hu
member.bio: Wenjia just got her BA in Cognitive Science from Lawrence University. She is passionate about collective intelligence and tools for thoughts. Her research interest lies in the intersection of complexity science and HCI. She is also a UX researcher, and teaches kids design thinking on the side.

member.name: Emelia May Hughes
member.bio: Emelia Hughes is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying Informatics and Drawing & Painting.

member.name: Ricky Grannis-Vu
member.bio: Ricky Grannis-Vu is an undergraduate student at Stanford University. He studies the design and governance of online communities, with a focus on the PolicyKit project. He also works as an instructor, curriculum designer, and program manager at Inspirit AI.
